Articles.Content:
The challenge is that you must launch a craft into orbit (however you wish, I.E. Mainsails and SRB's) but once in a stable orbit around kerbin, you must have a ion powered craft that has at least one kerbal aboard. The kerbal does not need a capsule, so you could use the external command seat for top efficiency. And with that you must go to minmus and reach a stable orbit, and land all with the power of ion engines. Return to kerbin is not necessary. Have at it

Easy: Minmus landing

Hard: Mun landing
Please see the Challenge Submission Guidelines on how to make a fun, challenging challenge for everyone to enjoy
Isn't it pretty hard to land on any object with just ion engines? 1 is enough for gilly, but you're scaling it up to minmus, so it'll require probably the laggiest craft ever made
I think it should only take 5 ion engines, which is a lot of energy to land on minmus. I might have done my mathematics all wrong for this challenge.

I think ion engines need to be defined. NFP has some pretty powerful engines in it which could easily do that. Am I allowed to use MPDTs or PITs or do I have to use stock ion thrusters?

Even the DS4G ion, which eats power like a son of a kerbal, gives 3 thrust vs the stock 0.5. The HI-SNAP engine gives 3.1 just without 6 digit delta Vs and can be clustered up to 4 and still run on a single 1.25m reactor.

Add in NFP and use the ionic engines there, and the challenge becomes trivial.
You can use any kind of ion engine from any mod, its just you need the ion engines. I was also doing my math on the stock parts and that might be why i see that just stock is impossible.
